ptserver.communication

Class TokenPublisher

  • java.lang.Object
    • ptserver.communication.TokenPublisher

  • public class TokenPublisher
extends java.lang.Object
    TokenPublisher batches tokens, converts to them binary and then publishes the result to the MQTT topic.

    The batch is sent it out periodically according to the period parameter.

    Since:
    Ptolemy II 10.0
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Anar Huseynov
    Accepted Rating:
    Red (ahuseyno)
    Proposed Rating:
    Red (ahuseyno)

      • TokenPublisher

        public TokenPublisher(long period,
                      ProxyModelInfrastructure proxyModelInfrastructure)
        Create instance of the TokenPublisher with specified period and tokensPerPeriod.
        Parameters:
        period - The period in milliseconds between batches
        proxyModelInfrastructure - The infrastructure that created this listener and controls the state of the execution.

      • sendToken

        public void sendToken(Token token,
                      ProxySink sender)
               throws IllegalActionException
        Send the token via MQTT protocol.

        The token will not be sent out immediately but would be batched for the specified period.

        Parameters:
        token - The token to send
        sender - The sink that produced the token. If the parameter is null, then the token was not produced by the model but programmatically i.e. for monitoring purposes.
        Throws:
        IllegalActionException - if there is a problem with MQTT broker.

      • setMqttClient

        public void setMqttClient(com.ibm.mqtt.IMqttClient mqttClient)
        Set the mqttClient to be used to publish the tokens.
        Parameters:
        mqttClient - the mqttClient to be used to publish the tokens.
        See Also:
        getMqttClient()

      • setTopic

        public void setTopic(java.lang.String topic)
        Set the topic for the message to publish.
        Parameters:
        topic - the topic to publish the MQTT messages.
        See Also:
        getTopic()
